name: UBY CREEK
statement:
**Elected Experience**  
None  
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
Educator for over 25 years and presently a Site Coordinator with Communities In Schools.  
  
**Education**  
Pasco HS graduate, CBC AA degree, Cambridge College Boston, MA, BA Multi-Disciplinary Studies  
  
**Community Service**  
Most recent: Graduate of Leadership TC Class XXV and newest Board member of 3 Rivers Community Foundation. Prior and Ongoing: Co-Chair or volunteer on; City of Kennewick Diversity Commission, Mirror Ministries Human non-profit, Bethel Benevolence Assistance Ministry, Hispanic Academic Achievement Program, Cavalcade of Bands & Drums along the Columbia, KEHS Instrumental Music Boosters, PTA Washington Elementary, Park MS and Kennewick HS, BFELA WA State Association of Head Start/ECEAP and Habitat for Humanity.  
  
**Statement**  
Uby has been a tireless volunteer and advocate for many in Kennewick for more than 35 yrs. and it has been those many years of volunteerism and advocacy that has prepared, developed and grown her leadership skills for a time such as this. Her unique position, a bilingual and biliterate woman, will add a much needed new perspective to the board. Kennewick has grown and is prime for someone who can be a bridge to its diverse citizens. Uby has loved being a resident of the Tri Cities for more than 50 years where she has lived with her husband of almost 40 years, raised her 2 daughters, a Nurse and an Attorney and is a happy grandmother to her 3 beautiful granddaughters.  
Contact: (509)374-5452; ubycreek@hotmail.com
